intro: Uragoga delpinoana, commonly known as the Delpinoan Urara, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid environment to flourish. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several national parks.
